competitors.name: Blue Yonder
competitors.notes: Formerly JDA Software, provides digital supply chain management and omnichannel commerce fulfillment solutions

competitors.name: SAP
competitors.notes: SAP Ariba Sourcing (19.18% market share), SAP Supply Chain Management (18.77%), SAP EWM for warehouse management

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Oracle Warehouse Management (WM) direct competitor in WMS market

competitors.name: Infor
competitors.notes: Primary competitor providing enterprise supply chain and WMS solutions

competitors.name: HighJump Software
competitors.notes: Primary competitor specializing in supply chain execution software

competitors.name: E2open
competitors.notes: Main competitor in supply chain management platform solutions

competitors.name: GT Nexus
competitors.notes: Top competitor in cloud-based supply chain collaboration

competitors.name: Descartes
competitors.notes: Top competitor in logistics and supply chain technology

competitors.name: SSI SCHAEFER
competitors.notes: Competitor in warehouse automation and logistics systems

competitors.name: Honeywell Intelligrated
competitors.notes: Competitor combining warehouse automation and software solutions

context: By 2020, Manhattan Associates held 1.07% market share in the supply chain management market, competing with 167 different tools in this category. The competitive landscape had evolved significantly, with SAP maintaining dominance through multiple products (Ariba, SCM, EWM). Blue Yonder (formerly JDA Software) had emerged as a major competitor after transforming into a digital supply chain platform. The market saw increased competition from both traditional enterprise software vendors (SAP, Oracle, Infor) and specialized supply chain platforms (E2open, GT Nexus, Descartes). Warehouse automation vendors like SSI SCHAEFER and Honeywell Intelligrated were also competing by combining hardware with software solutions. Manhattan ranked 6th among 746 active competitors.
